meanings.definition: The act of applying a protective or decorative coating to a surface, typically made of lacquer.
meanings.sent1: The lackering of the table made it shiny and protected from scratches.
meanings.sent2: She learned the art of lackering to beautify old furniture.
meanings.sent3: The lackering of the chair was so glossy that it reflected the sunlight into her eyes.
meanings.sent4: His lackering skills transformed the dull desk into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The lackering on the door was so smooth that it felt like touching glass.

meanings.definition: The process of finishing or refinishing furniture or other objects with lacquer.
meanings.sent1: After the lackering, the cabinet looked brand new.
meanings.sent2: The lackering of the dresser took hours to complete.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally spilled coffee on the lackering, creating a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: The lackering process turned the old chair into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The lackering on the frame gave it a professional and polished look.

meanings.definition: The practice of using lacquer to create a glossy or durable finish on a surface.
meanings.sent1: His lackering technique produced a flawless finish on the wood.
meanings.sent2: The lackering of the jewelry box made it shine like a diamond.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her lackering skills could make anything look expensive.
meanings.sent4: The lackering on the car was so reflective, it seemed like a mirror.
meanings.sent5: The lackering on the floor was so tough, even high heels couldn't scratch it.
